videos.title: Her Morning Elegance (2009)
videos.description: A collaborative stop motion film by musician Oren Lavie and Israeli photographer Eyal Landesman. The only stop-motion video to ever earn a grammy nomination, this whimsical video accompanies the song of same name by Lavie. The camera remains stationary while bedroom linens and clothing move across the mattress as personifications of the birds, trains, and fish she dreams of.
videos.director: Oren Lavie, Yuval and Merav Nathan
videos.additional_info:

A collaborative stop motion film by musician Oren Lavie and Israeli photographer Eyal Landesman. videos.alt_text: TID Exploring Time 005 by Builders Club
videos.title: TID Exploring Time 005 by Builders Club (2017)
videos.additional_info:
TID Exploring Time 005 by Builders Club (2017)
'It's an observation of a moment in time and what happens to our mind when we let go and start drifting away. Something ordinary suddenly becomes the impulse for our imagination and we find ourselves wondering where reality ends and imagination starts. Only to wake up realising that it was only relativity playing with us.' Director: Jonas & Julien Production: Builders Club Producer/Editor: Jonas Hegi VFX: Builders Club Prod Coord.: Ester Viana Art Direction: Viviana Fagnani DOP: Tom Elliott AC: Marit de Bruijne Phantom OP: Joe Werry Styling: Coline Bach Hair & Makeup: Lucinda Worth

videos.title: The Gentlemen (TV Series) (2024)
videos.description: Season 1. Episode 6. Eddie Horniman inherits a family estate, initially unaware its home to a drug empire run by a syndicate that has no plans to vacate. In this episode, Eddie's doubts about Susie continue to grow. But there's 15 million pounds of dirty money to be laundered before she'll consider leaving the estate. Created by Guy Ritchie.

videos.title: Sabrina Carpenter - Espresso (2024)
videos.description: The music video for Sabrina Carpenter's song "Espresso," released in 2024, was directed by Dave Meyers. The video features vibrant and sun-soaked visuals, showcasing Carpenter in various stylish outfits as she navigates a dreamy, retro-inspired setting. With a playful and energetic vibe, the video highlights Carpenter's charisma and the song's catchy, upbeat nature. The creative direction was managed by Jacobi Mehringer and Anna Arnell, adding to the video's polished and dynamic aesthetic.
videos.additional_info:
Sabrina Carpenter - Espresso (2024)
The music video for Sabrina Carpenter's song "Espresso," released in 2024, was directed by Dave Meyers. The video features vibrant and sun-soaked visuals, showcasing Carpenter in various stylish outfits as she navigates a dreamy, retro-inspired setting. With a playful and energetic vibe, the video highlights Carpenter's charisma and the song's catchy, upbeat nature. The creative direction was managed by Jacobi Mehringer and Anna Arnell, adding to the video's polished and dynamic aesthetic.

videos.title: A$AP Rocky - A$AP Forever (2018)
videos.description: A$AP Rocky returns as the "fashion killa" in the music video for his latest single, "A$AP Forever," featuring Moby. Directed by Dexter Navy, the video features Rocky and the A$AP Mob in various New York locations, with a cameo by Moby, credited for the heavy sampling of his 1999 hit "Porcelain."

videos.title: Audrey Nuna - Cellulite (2023)
videos.description: Audrey Nuna's "Cellulite" music video, directed by Zac Dov, is a vivid narrative of self-liberation and defiance, drawing inspiration from icons like the Pharcyde and Missy Elliott. The video visually represents Nuna's personal theme of overcoming constraints, symbolized by motifs of flying and motion, reflecting her introspective yet rebellious spirit. It's a cinematic portrayal of cutting out life's "toxic fat," aiming to resonate with viewers on a journey of spiritual unburdening.
videos.additional_info:

It's a cinematic portrayal of cutting out life's "toxic fat," aiming to resonate with viewers on a journey of spiritual unburdening.

videos.alt_text: Lil Nas X, Youngboy Never Broke Again - Late To Da Party
videos.title: Lil Nas X, Youngboy Never Broke Again - Late To Da Party (2022)
videos.description: The music video for "Late to da Party (F*ck BET)" by Lil Nas X and YoungBoy Never Broke Again features provocative imagery, including Lil Nas X urinating on a BET Award, to criticize and satirize the entertainment industry, particularly for Lil Nas X's exclusion from BET Awards nominations.
videos.additional_info:
Lil Nas X, Youngboy Never Broke Again - Late To Da Party (2022)
The music video for "Late to da Party (F*ck BET)" by Lil Nas X and YoungBoy Never Broke Again features provocative imagery, including Lil Nas X urinating on a BET Award, to criticize and satirize the entertainment industry, particularly for Lil Nas X's exclusion from BET Awards nominations.
Technique - Background replacement , BTS , Flying , Stylistic Suck
Director - Gibson Hazard
DOP - Russ Fraser
Editor - Chris Villa

videos.title: Sub Urban - UH OH! (feat. BENEE) (2022)
videos.director: Erin McCaffrey, Rock Paper Scissors, Sebastian Zotoff
videos.additional_info:
Sub Urban - UH OH! (feat. BENEE) (2022)
In Andrew Donoho's "Uh Oh" video, Sub Urban, portraying an imperfect Jehovah's Witness, disturbs an idyllic suburban neighborhood, blurring the line between who is truly the source of terror. Credits: Story & Creative Direction by Sub Urban Directed by Andrew Donoho Production Company - Obsidian Executive Producer - Doug Klinger Head of Production - Anna Heinrich Producer - Ian Blair Director’s Rep - Doug Klinger at Reprobates Production Manager - Kristen Brancaccio Production Coordinator - John Wayne Leingang Director of Photography - Kristian Zuniga Assistant Director - Michael Estrella 2nd Assistant Director - Mike Roque 1st AC - Jackie Vresics 2nd AC - Aaron Brenner Steadicam - Loren Hamilton Gaffer - Drew Valenti ACLT - Dominic D'astice Hyphenate - David Veerman Key Grip - Ed Barraza Best Grip - Jason Webster Grip - Gaither Narron
Technique - Flying , Unsettling
Director - Andrew Donoho
DOP - Kristian Zuniga
Editor - Erin McCaffrey, Rock Pap
